title: A conjecture on descents, inversions and the weak order
abstract:
In this article, we discuss the notion of partition of elements in an
arbitrary Coxeter system $(W,S)$: a partition of an element $w$ is a subset
$\mathcal P\subseteq W$ such that the left inversion set of $w$ is the disjoint
union of the left inversion set of the elements in $\mathcal P$. Partitions of
elements of $W$ arises in the study of the Belkale-Kumar product on the
cohomology $H^*(X,\mathbb Z)$, where $X$ is the complete flag variety of any
complex semi-simple algebraic group. Partitions of elements in the symmetric
group $\mathcal S_n$ are also related to the {\em Babington-Smith model} in
algebraic statistics or to the simplicial faces of the Littlewood-Richardson
cone.
  We state the conjecture that the number of right descents of $w$ is the sum
of the number of right descents of the elements of $\mathcal P$ and prove that
this conjecture holds in the cases of symmetric groups (type $A$) and
hyperoctahedral groups (type $B$).
